feedback.html: Good job!
No, that's not right. Use a hint if you need to, and try again!

content.html:
"Great job!" said Omar.

"To fill in the third row of the multiplication table, write the multiples from 3 * 1 to 3 * 5 in order. Separate them with commas. Don't include any spaces! (Ex. a,b,c,d,e)"

feedback.html: Good job!
No, that's not right. Use a hint if you need to, and try again!

content.html:
"Perfect!" said Omar, watering the carrot seeds as Aria worked on filling in the first row of her multiplication table.

"To fill in the second row of the multiplication table, write the multiples from 2 * 1 to 2 * 5 in order. Separate them with commas. Don't include any spaces! (Ex. a,b,c,d,e)"

feedback.html: Correct, good job!
Correct, good job!
No, that's not right. Use the hint if you need to, and go back to study your multiples if you need to (that's okay!). Then, come back and try again!

hint_content.html: The first five multiples of 2 are 2 * 1, 2 * 2, 2 * 3, 2 * 4, and 2 * 5.

content.html:
"That last problem was challenging!" said Omar. "Let's try a similar problem (but with a helpful hint!) to see if you understand the concept of multiples."

"List the first five multiples of 4. Make sure to separate your multiples with commas (example: 3,6,9,12)."

hi.html:
"vah ek bohot kathin savaal tha!" umar ne kaha.

"chalo ek aur savaal karen (lekin ek sahaayak sanket ke saath!) yah dekhane ke lie ki kya aap gunakon ko samajhate hain ya nahi."

2 ke pahale paanch gunakon ko likho. apane uttar mein comma aur space ka upyog karo. (poorv: 3, 6, 9, 12, 15).

content.html:
“Good job!" said Omar. "We can plant eight carrots!"

As Aria and Omar planted the carrot seeds, Omar talked to Aria about something new: memorizing multiples.

“Because multiplication is so important and we use it every day," Omar said, "it is important for you to memorize the answers to simple multiplication expressions."

“Why do we need to memorize them? Why can’t we just use pictures or addition expressions?" asked Aria.

“Because we need to use multiplication so much in real life, If we memorize the answers to those smaller problems, it would be faster to multiply than add up a lot of numbers, like 7 + 7 + 7 + 7 + 7 + 7 + 7 + 7!” explained Omar.

hi.html:
"bahut achchha kaam!" umar ne kaha. "hamne 8 gaajar ke paudhe ko lagaye !

umar ne aariya se kuchh naya karane ke lie baat kee: gunakon ko yaad karna.

umar ne kaha, "kyonki guna karana bahut mahatvapoorn hai aur ham har din isaka upayog karate hain," aap gunan abhivyaktiyon ke uttaron ko yaad karna chahiye."

“hamen unhen yaad karane kyon hai? ham chitron ya jodne abhivyaktiyon ka upayog kyon nahin kar sakate? "aariya ne poochha.

"kyonki hamen jeevan mein guna ka bahut zyaada upayog karane kee jaroorat paddegi, Par agar ham un chhotee prashn ke uttar yaad karate hain, to ham tejee se guna kar sakate hain!" umar ne samajhaaya.

feedback.html: Good job!
No, that's not right. Use a hint if you need to and try again!

content.html:
"Amazing job!" exclaimed Omar.

"To fill in the fifth row of the multiplication table, write the multiples from 5 * 1 to 5 * 5 in order. Separate them with commas. Don't include any spaces! (Ex. a,b,c,d,e)"

feedback.html: Good job!
No, that's not correct. Use a hint if you need to, and try again!

hint_content.html: The first five multiples of 4 are: 4*1, 4*2, 4*3, 4*4, 4*5. Evaluate these.

content.html:
Omar looked at Aria's progress. "Nice job!" he remarked.

"To fill in the fourth row of the multiplication table, write the multiples from 4 * 1 to 4 * 5 in order. Separate them with commas. Don't include any spaces! (Ex. a,b,c,d,e)"

In the last part of our story, Aria and her father, Omar, finished planting their fruits! Now, they will get to enjoy tasty melons and strawberries. In this lesson, we’ll continue following Aria as she practices her multiplication skills in the garden.

You should know the following before going on:

  • How to write and evaluate addition expressions

  • How to tell the “place values” in a number (e.g. ones, tens, hundreds, etc.)

  • The meaning of multiplication and the Commutative Property of Multiplication

You should also get some paper and a pen or pencil to write with, and find a quiet place to work. Take your time and go through the story at your own pace. Understanding is more important than speed!

Once you’re ready, click Continue to get started!

hi.html:
aariya ke saath hamaaree kahaanee ke pichle paath mein, aariya aur umar ne apane phal lagaana samaapt kar diya! das haphton mein, unhen svaadisht tarabooj aur stroberee khane ko milenge. is paath mein, ham ariya ke saath apane gunan kaushal ka abhyaas karatee hai.

aage badhane se pahale aapako pata honi chaahie:

jodna abhivyaktiyon ko kaise likhane hai aur unke jawaab kaise dene hai

ek sankhya mein "sthaan maan" ke naam kaise diya jaye.

gunan aur gunan ka krumvinimay niyam ke arth

aapako likhne ke lie kuchh kaagaj aur ek pen ya pensil honi chaahie aur kaam karane ke lie ek shaant jagah dhundhni chaahie. apana samay le lo aur aaram se kahaani padho. taiyaar hone ke baad, continue button par klik karo!

feedback.html: Good job!
No, that's not right. The first five multiples of 1 are 1*1, 1*2, 1*3, 1*4, 1*5. Try again!

content.html:
“Good work!” said Omar. “Now that you’ve memorized your multiples, you should be able to easily fill in a multiplication table to help you remember and reference it when solving multiplication problems. Even if you haven’t completely memorized them yet, use this table to help you. If you can memorize them, then you’ll be able to do these problems more easily!”

"To fill in the first row of the multiplication table, write the multiples from 1 * 1 to 1 * 5 in order. Separate them with commas. Don't include any spaces! (Ex. a,b,c,d,e)"

Congratulations! You made it! 

In this exploration, you and Aria learned about:

  • The meaning of multiplication

  • Multiplying two-factor expressions where both factors are less than or equal to 5

  • Memorizing multiplication expressions for later use

  • The relationships between addition expressions and multiplication expressions

If you haven't already, make sure to memorize the part of the multiplication table you've seen so far. Do this before starting the next chapter, since you will need it in future chapters!

Come back next time to help Aria plant her larger vegetables: cucumbers and tomatoes!

hi.html:
badhai ho! Aapne iss paath ko pura padh liya!

iss paath mein, aapane aur aariya ne seekha:

guna ka arth

do-ghatak abhivyaktiyon ko guna karana, jahaan donon ghatak 5 se kam ya usake baraabar hain

baad ke upayog ke lie gunan abhivyaktiyon ko yaad karana

jodna abhivyaktiyon aur gunan abhivyaktiyon ke beech sambandh

agalee baar vaapas aao aariya ki madad karne ke liye, badee sabjiyaan ko lagaane main: kheere aur tamaatar!

feedback.html: Correct, good job :)
No, not quite. Remember that multiplying a number by 2 is the same thing as adding it to itself. Try again!

content.html:
"Good work there!" said Omar, laying two pea seeds in 6 square centimeters of soil.

"I knew that in 3 + 3, there are two 3s," said Aria, "so, we can use 3 * 2 to find out how many square centimeters of land we need for the peas!” 

"Yes!" replied Omar. “Adding a number to itself is always the same thing as multiplying it by 2! Knowing this, can you write an addition expression to represent 30 * 2?"

hi.html:
" bahut achchha kaam!", omar ne kaha. Unhone 6 senteemeetar mittee mein do matar ke beej daalen. 

"mujhe pata tha ki 3 + 3 mein, do 3 hain," aariya ne kaha, "isalie ham 3 * 2 ka upayog karake pata laga sakate hain ki hamen matar ke lie kitane senteemeetar mittee chahiye!"

"haan!" omar ne javaab diya. “ ek sankhya ko khud se jodana hamesha ise 2 se guna karne ke samaan hai! yah jaanate hue, kya aap 30 * 2 ke lie ek jodna abhivyakti likh sakate hain? "
Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Yaad rakho ki ek sankhya ko khud se jodana hamesha ise 2 se guna karne ke samaan hai!

feedback.html: Correct, wonderful job!

No, that's not right. Write a multiplication expression for this situation (drawing a picture may help).  Then, if you need to, go back and fully memorize all your multiples from 1 * 1 to 5 * 5, and try again!

content.html:
"That last question was really tricky!" said Omar, munching on some fruit. "Let's give this similar one a try!"

Omar has 3 grapes in each of his 2 hands. How many grapes does he have in total?

feedback.html: Nice! That's correct.
No, that's not correct. Let's try a similar problem and give you a second chance!

content.html:
"Good work!" said Omar excitedly. "You're almost there. Just a few more problems to make sure you understand what you learned in this lesson!"

"List the first five multiples of 4. Make sure to separate your multiples with commas (example: 3,6,9,12)."

"Great job!" said Omar. "You've filled out the multiplication table from 1 * 1 to 5 * 5!"

Aria beamed. "I've memorized these multiples!" she said. "But, how do I read this table?"

"Single-digit multiplication expressions can be solved with this table. Your first factor is a number at the side of each row. Your second factor is the number at the top of each column."

feedback.html: Correct!
No, that's not correct. To solve 5*5, you need to find the box in common with the red 5's column and the blue 5's row. Try again!
No, that's not right. We will go back to the card where Omar explains to Aria how to use a multiplication table with his hands. Then, come back, use a hint if you need to, and try again!

hint_content.html: The answer to 5 * 5 is the number under the red 5 (first factor) and in the row with the blue 5 (second factor). Which number is this?

content.html:
"I get it!" said Aria. "Let me try!"

"Alright," said Omar. "Using the multiplication table, find the answer to 5 * 5."

Aria was learning more about multiplication and using it to plan her garden with Omar.

Aria knew she wanted to plant peas and carrots. “Great!” said Omar. “Now, we just need to figure out how much space we need to plant them!”

“Let’s plant the peas first!” said Aria.

“Sure!” said Omar. “And, at the same time, let’s do more multiplication practice with a very special case: multiplying by 2.”

hi.html:
aariya apane pita, umar ke saath apane bageeche kee yojana banaane ke lie gunan ke baare mein aur adhik seekh rahee thee.

aariya jaanatee thee ki vah matar aur gaajar lagaana chaahatee hai. "Badiya!" umar ne kaha. "ab, hamen keval yah pata lagaana hai ki hamen unhen lagaane ke lie kitanee jagah chaahie!"

"pahale matar ka paudha lagao!" aariya ne kaha.

"zaroor!" umar ne kaha. "aur,  2 se guna karna bhi abhyaas karte hain."

feedback.html: Correct! Wonderful job!
No, that's not correct. Let's try another similar question!

content.html:
"Just one more question!" said Omar. "Let's do this!"

"There are five rows of soil in an empty planter bed. Each row can fit five seeds. How many seeds can we plant in this planter bed?"

“How did you memorize your multiples when you were a kid, Dad?” asked Aria.

“We didn’t have computers back then,” said Omar. “We used to sit down, get a paper and pencil, and write down the multiples of every number, like this!"

“Hmm…I’ll try that!” said Aria. “I know that writing things down helps me remember them better!”

“Yeah!” said Omar. “Since you understand why you should get really good at memorizing your multiples, I’m going to give you some advice: write down all the multiples from 1 * 1 to 5 * 5 every day for 3 days.”

“3 days?” thought Aria. “Well…it’ll take just 10 minutes every day; I can do it!”

Aria will write down her multiples from 1 * 1 to 5 * 5 every day. You should do this with her, too!

hi.html:
"jab aap ek bachche the, to aap gunakon ko kaise yaad karate the?" aariya ne poochha.

umar ne kaha, "hamaare paas tab computer nahin the." "ham baithate the, ek pepar aur pensil lete the, aur har sankhya ke gunakon ko is tarah likhate the!"

"main koshish karungi!" aariya ne kaha. "mujhe pata hai ki cheejon ko likhana mujhe behatar yaad rakhane mein madad karti hai!"

"haan!" umar ne kaha. "kyunki aap samajhate hain ki aapako apane gunakon ko yaad kyun karne hain, main aapako kuchh salaah deta hu: teen dinon ke lie har din 1 * 1 se 5 * 5 tak sabhee gunakon likho."

"teen din?" aariya ne socha. "theek hai ... yah har din sirph 10 minat lagega, main yah kar sakti hoon!"

feedback.html: Great job!
No, that's not right. Let's try a similar problem!

content.html:
“Great work!’ said Omar. “I’m very proud of you for memorizing these multiples! You will soon get very fast at multiplication and can solve more problems in the garden and in your life!"

“Now, I'm going to quiz you on a few questions! What is 4 * 5?"

feedback.html: Correct, great job!
No, that's not right. Make sure you have all your multiples from 1 * 1 to 5 * 5 memorized. It may be useful to spend more time studying the multiplication table a few cards back. Then, try again!

content.html:
"That last one was a little tricky!" says Omar. "Let's try a similar problem."

"What is 5 * 2?"

feedback.html: Correct!
No, that's not correct. Remember that multiplying a number by 2 is the same thing as adding it to itself. For example, 8 * 2 is the same thing as 8 + 8. Try again!

content.html: “All right!” said Omar. “Now that you understand that any number multiplied by 2 is the same thing as adding that number to itself, let’s do one more problem for practice! What is 2 * 5?"

feedback.html: Correct! According to the Commutative Property of Multiplication, 3 * 2 can also be written as 2 * 3. The addition expression for 2 * 3 is 2 + 2 + 2, so 2 + 2 + 2 is also an addition expression for 3 * 2.
No, that's not right. Try again.

hint_content.html: The Commutative Property of Multiplication states that a * b = b * a if a and b are both numbers!

content.html: "Good job, Aria!" said Omar. "That's correct: 3 * 2 can be written as 3 + 3. But, now I'm wondering: can we also say that 2 + 2 + 2 is an addition expression for 3 * 2?

hi.html: Sahi hai! krumvinimay niyam ke anusaar, 3*2 2*3 ke roop main bhi likha jaa sakta hai. In dono gunan abhivyaktiyon ke liye jodna abhivyakti 2+2+2 hai.

feedback.html: That's right!
Not quite, try again! Don't overthink it :)

content.html:
“Great!” said Omar. “Let’s try another one."

"What is 2 * 2 as an addition expression?"

feedback.html: Yes, that's correct!
No, that's not correct. Try again, and use a hint if you need to!

hint_content.html:
When you are converting a multiplication expression to an addition expression, remember that you are adding the first number to itself the second number of times.

For example, the multiplication expression 4 * 3 can be converted to an addition expression by adding 4 to itself three times: 4 + 4 + 4. Try again!

content.html:
“Let’s get started” said Omar. “Let’s see if you can answer a few questions about multiplying by 2!”

"What is 3 * 2 as an addition expression?"

hi.html: Jab aap ek gunan abhivyakti ko ek jodna abhivyakti mein bana rahe ho, toh aap pahale sankhya ko khud se jod rahe hain, doosare sankhya ke baar. Udhaaran ke liye, 4*3 4+4+4 ke roop mein bhi likha jaa sakta hai. Phir se koshish karo.

feedback.html: Correct!
No, that's not right. Use a hint if you need to, and try again!

hint_content.html: This looks like a multiplying by 2 problem similar to the one we just did. Think back to the last problem, where we calculated the amount of water needed for the pea plants.

In the last problem, we had 2 pea plants and each one needed 4 litres of water. In this problem, you have 4 carrots and each carrot needs 2 square centimeters of land. How can the Commutative Property of Multiplication help you solve this problem?

content.html:
Aria and Omar have finished planting and watering their pea plants!

"Yay!" said Aria. "Now, I want to find out how much space I need to plant all our carrots!"

"Hmm..." said Omar. "If we want to plant four carrots and each carrot needs 2 square centimeters of space to grow, how many square centimeters of land would we need to plant all your carrots?"

hi.html:
ariya aur umar ne apane matar ke paudhon ko lagaaya aur unko paanee bhi de diya!

ab, aariya yah jaanana chaahatee hai ki use apane sabhee gaajar lagaane ke lie kitanee jagah chaahie.

Agar aariya 4 gaajar ke paudhe lagaana chaahatee hai aur har ek gaajar ka paudha ko ugaane ke lie 2 cm mittee kee jaroorat hai, to use apane sabhee gaajar ke paudhe ko kitane senteemeetar mittee par lagaane hogee?

feedback.html: Correct!
No, that's not correct. 4 litres of water are needed to water 1 pea plant. The question asks how many are needed to water 2 pea plants.
No, that's not correct. The expression for this situation is not 4 + 2. The first plant needs 4 litres, and the second pea plant also needs 4 litres. How many litres is this in total? Try again!
No, that's not correct! Try again.

hint_content.html: Each pea plant needs 4 liters of water, and there are 2 pea plants. This sounds like a multiplying by two problem. Try writing a multiplication expression to represent this situation.

A multiplication expression we can write for this situation is 4 * 2, because each pea plant needs 4 liters of water, and there are 2 plants. Now, remember that when you multiply a number by two, it is the same thing as adding that number to itself. Write an addition expression to represent 4 * 2 and solve!

content.html:
“Good work there!” said Omar. “Now that we've planted our pea seeds, Aria..."

"...we need to water them!" Aria finished.

"Yes," said Omar. "If each pea plant needs 4 liters of water, how many liters of water would you need to plant two pea plants?

Aria was confused. "How do you solve a multiplication expression with that table?"

Omar smiled. "Let's say the problem is 4 * 3." He circled the "4" at the side of the table. "That's our first factor." Then, he pointed to the "3" at the top of the table. "That's our second factor."

"Now, all we have to do is find the box in the table which is next to the 4 and under the 3! That box is 12, which I just circled. So 4 * 3 = 12!"

hi.html:
"aap us chart ke saath gunan kaise kar sakte ho?"aria ne pucha.

 Omar muskuraya. "maan lo ki savaal 4 * 5. hai." unhonne laal 4 kee or ishaara kiya. "yah hamaara pahala ghatak hai." phir, usane neele 5 ko ishaara kiya. "yah hamaara doosara ghatak hai!"

"ab, hamen bas pata lagana hai ki kaunsi sankhya laal nambar 4 ke neeche hai aur neela nambar 5 ke pakti mein hai! yeh sakhya 20 hai. to 4 * 5 = 20! "

feedback.html: That's right!

That's not correct. Look at the picture on the seed packet. Each brown rectangle is a square centimeter. One pea seed needs three square centimeters of soil. Try again, or go back to last lesson and learn how to write and solve a multiplication expression given a picture.

content.html:
“How will we figure out how much space we need for our peas?” asked Aria.

Omar spoke. “We need to figure out how many plants we want to grow and multiply that number by the amount of space each plant needs.”

Aria replied, “The pea seed packet has a picture on the back, showing us how much space each plant needs!”  

Aria looked at the picture. "Each pea plant needs 3 square centimeters of land," she thought. "What multiplication expression could we use to find out how many square centimeters of land we need for two pea plants?"

"ham yah kaise pata laga sakte hain ki hamen apane matar ke paudho ke lie kitanee jagah chaahie?" aariya ne poochha.

umar ne kaha, "hamen yah pata lagaane kee hum kitane paudhon ko ugaana chaahate hain, aur har ek paudha ko kitni jagah chahiye hogi. Inn dono sankhya ki guna karana hoga."

aariya ne javaab diya, "matar ke beej ke paiket ke peechhe ek tasveer hai, jo hamen dikhaatee hai ki har ek paudha ko kitanee jagah chaahie!"

aariya ne tasveer ko dekha. "pratyek matar ke paudhe ko 3 senteemeetar jameen chahiye," usane socha. "do paudhon ke liye jagah pata lagane ke liye ham kaunsa gunan abhivyakti ka upayog kar sakate hain?"

feedback.html: Great work!
Almost! You know that this is a multiplication equations, and that factors are numbers in multiplication equations. However, 24 is not a factor, it is a different kind of number.
Try again. Addends are used in addition expressions, but this is a multiplication equation!
Try again. Sums are used in addition expressions, but this is a multiplication equation!

content.html: While Aria and Omar are eating cookies, Aria remembers she has a math problem for homework tonight! One of the equations she sees on her paper is 3 * 8 = 24. In this equation, what would we call 24?

feedback.html: Good job!
Good job!

Aria looks at the next question on her worksheet. It asks, "Based on the Commutative Property of Multiplication, what is another way of writing 5 * 3?"

content.html:
Aria and Omar are enjoying some cookies. Later, they will go into the garden to start planting their vegetables!

"Yesterday, we finished planting melons and strawberries," said Omar. "Today, we are going to plant our smaller vegetables: peas and carrots!"

"But, before we move on though, let’s make sure that you remember the things we discussed in the last lesson! Which of these pictures shows 1 * 5?"

exploration.title: Single Digit Expressions From 1 to 5
exploration.objective: Learn how to evaluate single-digit multiplication expressions until 5 * 5
